Note: "Operating out of Florence... he offered a service that took in almost the entire network: it covered all of Italy, from Milan and Venice to Rome an dNAples, and extended beyond, throughout all of western Europe, to Geneva, Lyons, Catalonia, Lisbon, Bruges and London. He carried about four hundred letters a year for the Cambini company alone, and in one eighteenth-month period in 1473-74 he sent eighty one couriers ot Venice for the wool firm of Benedetto di Antonio Salutati and Ristoro di Antonio Serristori. He offered a kind of subscription, contracting his service for set periods of itme; thus one of his clients, the firm of Filippo and Lorenzo di MAtteo Strozzi, paid him 40 lire on 1 January 1473 to handle all their correspondence ot and from Rome for a year." (95)

"The mounted courier Jörg Paungartner, for example, came from at least three generations of Habsburg retainers. He described in his February 1528 petition for back-pay how, after several years
as courier for the Treasury Chancellery, he was seconded to Ferdinand’s orator in Venice, together with two horses. He transmitted dispatches ‘day and night’ between Venice and Innsbruck for more than a year, but complained

Lutter, 1998, pp.104–123).
